listitem.para: Verbose mode. Contact the broker for out of band status messages about the request while it is being processed. These messages are printed on stderr. This is the default for commands that are not read-only.
Turn off verbose mode. Do not make a secondary request to the broker for out of band status messages. This is the default for read-only commands.

For any command that returns status 207 (MULTI_STATUS) indicating some success and some failure, --partialok causes the client to exit with status code 0 instead of exit code 2. Warning messages will still go to stderr. --nopartialok is the default.
Generate debug statements sent to stderr. Some commands may also increase output from the server on stdout.
Show the URL being accessed and the response code. Implied by --debug.

Specify the output format. The default is raw. Other common formats are proto for Google protobuf format, html, and csv. Check the documentation of the individual commands to see what formats they support.
Controls the authentication mechanism. --auth uses KNC for authentication and encryption. This is the default. --noauth disables both authentication and encryption.
--exec enables the client to execute commands sent back by the server, and it is the default. --noexec disables executing any commands.
Connect to the port number PORT instead of the default. The default port is 6900 for authenticated, and 6901 for non-authenticated connections.
Name of the server to connect to.
Name of the Kerberos service principal used to authenticate to the server. Should default correctly, only useful for development.
